pages.text: Metal is made by first smelting ore into a $(item)Bloom$() using a $(item)Bloomery$(), then using a $(thing)Hammer$() on the $(item)Bloom$().$(p)$(warning) Holding a $(item)Bloom$() with your bare hands will burn you.$(p)$(info) It is important to always handle a $(item)Bloom$() with $(thing)Tongs$().

pages.title: Hammering a Bloom
pages.text: A $(item)Bloom$() can be hammered on the ground or on an $(thing)Anvil$().$(p)$(warning) Hammering a $(item)Bloom$() on the ground will cause it to pop into the world and likely break the block beneath it.$(p)$(warning) Hammering a $(item)Bloom$() may cause fires.$(p)$(info) Hammering a $(item)Bloom$() on an $(thing)Anvil$() is much safer.

pages.title: Hammer Power
pages.text: $(thing)Hammer Power$() is the measure of how effective a hammer is when hammering a $(item)Bloom$().$(p)$(info) $(thing)Hammer Power$() is affected by your distance from the $(item)Bloom$(). The closer you stand, the more power your hammer will have.$(p)$(warning) Hammering a $(item)Bloom$() will make you hungry. If your hammer blows are ineffective, eat.

pages.title: Efficiency
pages.text: $(info) Adding the $(item)Efficiency$() enchantment to a $(thing)Hammer$() will increase its $(thing)Hammer Power$().

pages.title: Strength
pages.text: $(info) Swallowing a $(item)Potion of Strength$() will also increase your $(thing)Hammer Power$().$(p)$(info) Conversely, the $(thing)Weakness$() and $(thing)Mining Fatigue$() effects will decrease your $(thing)Hammer Power$().

pages.title: Fortune
pages.text: $(info) Adding the $(item)Fortune$() enchantment to a $(thing)Hammer$() will increase the chance that a $(item)Bloom$() will not lose integrity when hammered.

pages.title: Silk Touch
pages.text: $(info) Adding the $(item)Silk Touch$() enchantment to a $(thing)Hammer$() will dramatically reduce the chance that hammering a $(item)Bloom$() will fail and produce slag.
